descript.supplinf: Summary: A flaw lead is a natural opening in the sea ice that forms and persists throughout the winter, providing an exceptional opportunity to study the Arctic Ocean. This project is looking at ocean dynamics, climate, marine ecosystems, contaminants, greenhouse gases and carbon and nutrient cycles. The data was collected during the first ever overwintering of an icebreaker, the CCGS Amundsen, in a flaw lead system in the Canadian Arctic. Results are helping explain and predict how climate change will affect a flaw lead system. In addition, traditional knowledge is providing further perspective of how the Arctic Ocean has changed over time. Research Program(s): IPY. For further information: 476 Wallace Building, University of Manitoba, Winnipeg, Manitoba, R3T 2N2, Canada, dbarber@cc.umanitoba.ca
